meanings.definition: A continually repeated musical phrase or rhythm.
meanings.sent1: The composer incorporated catchy ostinatos in the song to create a memorable melody.
meanings.sent2: The pianist played the ostinatos on a loop throughout the entire piece.
meanings.sent3: The audience couldn't help but tap their feet to the infectious ostinatos.
meanings.sent4: The ostinatos in the background added a layer of depth to the music.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive nature of the ostinatos made the song stick in my head for days.

meanings.definition: A persistent or stubborn pattern or behavior.
meanings.sent1: His ostinatos of arriving late to work became a source of frustration for his colleagues.
meanings.sent2: The child's refusal to eat vegetables was an ostinatos at the dinner table.
meanings.sent3: Despite his friends' teasing, he stuck to his ostinatos of wearing mismatched socks.
meanings.sent4: Her ostinatos of always taking charge in group projects earned her the nickname 'Boss.'
meanings.sent5: The dog's ostinatos of barking at the mailman every morning were both amusing and annoying.
